title: epic events
tagline: CLI CRM for an event agency
description: Manage your events, clients, contracts, and teammate profiles with an ergonomic, intuitive Command Line Interface.
challenges: Implemented the PostgreSQL database and secured the application with password hashing and JWT authentication.
features: End-to-end CLI flow - Intuitive, styled terminal interface powered by Rich to create and update events, manage clients, and oversee teammates.
Secure sign-in and data - Permission and validation system that guarantees data integrity and reinforces security.
PostgreSQL database - Automatic persistence of all data with a dedicated schema that is robust and scalable.
JWT authentication - Sign-in and permission system based on JWT to protect user data.
Action logging - Errors and user actions logged through Sentry.

title: GUDLFT
description: Flask application for clubs: secretaries register athletes for competitions by spending club points, with quotas and availability checks.
features: Authentication (secretaries / admin)
Upcoming competitions list (remaining slots)
Athlete booking (1 point = 1 slot)
Limits: club balance, maximum 12 slots per competition per club
Cancellation with point refund (before the event)
Admin area: CRUD for clubs / competitions / users / bookings
Testing and debugging campaign (Pytest)

title: SoftDesk Support
description:
REST API built with Django REST Framework to manage projects, contributors, tickets (issues), and comments, secured with JWT. Strict scopes per project and per author.

## Endpoint examples

**User Detail endpoint**: Displays data for an individual user (restricted to authenticated users viewing their own profile). Returns username, email, age, contact preferences, and account creation date.

**User List endpoint**: Displays a paginated list of users accessible to authenticated users, showing username and ID with pagination metadata.
features: JWT authentication (SimpleJWT)
Project CRUD with contributor management
Per-project ticket CRUD (issue / request)
Per-ticket comment CRUD
Strong permissions (visibility limited to contributors)
List pagination
OpenAPI/Swagger documentation

title: LITReview
description: Django application that lets readers publish tickets (review requests) and reviews, follow other users, comment, and browse a combined feed.
features: Authentication (test accounts provided)
Create tickets (request a review)
Publish reviews (linked or not to a ticket)
News feed (tickets and reviews from subscriptions)
Follow / unfollow users
Edit / delete your own content

title: JustStreamIt
tagline: Dynamic app showing top-rated movies from IMDb
description: JavaScript front end that consumes the OCMovies API (OpenClassrooms) to display the top movie, category-based leaderboards, and detailed modal cards (poster, synopsis, cast).
challenges: Learning JavaScript fundamentals, first API interactions
learnings: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Dynamic rendering, AJAX calls
features: Top-rated movie highlighted in the hero (poster plus short synopsis)
Best movies and genre carousels
Detailed modal card opens on poster click
Pagination handled via the OCMovies API
Responsive UI (vanilla HTML/CSS/JS)

title: OC Lettings
tagline: Scaling a whole Django project and deploying it with Docker, GitHub Actions and Render
description: Django application for real estate agency. It was needing refactoring and scaling to improve performance and security. A few bugs were fixed, tests were added and the project got containerized with Docker and deployed to Render. CI/CD pipeline was set up with
challenges: Learning Docker fundamentals, Setting up a CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions, Building documentation with Sphinx
learnings: Django, Docker, GitHub Actions, Render, CI/CD, Pytest, Sentry, Sphinx, Read the Docs
features: Tests covering 88% of the codebase
Documentation built with Sphinx and hosted on Read the Docs
Docker image available at `docker pull dgggl88/oc-lettings:latest`
Deployed on Render at https://oc-lettings-x670.onrender.com

title: AlgoInvest&Trade
description: This program implements two algorithmic approaches to solve the knapsack problem: it calculates the most profitable stock portfolio possible for a maximum budget of 500 EUR (use case for the fictional company AlgoInvest&Trade).
challenges: Understand how the knapsack algorithm is constructed
learnings: Big O notation, brute force, dynamic programming
features: Exhaustive brute force - Explores every possible stock combination to guarantee the optimal profit, at the cost of exponential runtime (O(2^n)).
Dynamic programming - Optimized knapsack-style algorithm, much faster (approx. O(n * W)), recommended once the list exceeds about 20 assets and using memoization to avoid redundant calculations.
Invalid data report - Optional mode that detects and reports corrupted or unusable data in the provided datasets (for example negative costs or profits, missing values, and more).

title: ChessUp
description: Organize and run a full chess open, from the first move to the awards ceremony, without ever leaving your terminal: no spreadsheets, no hassle, just the game.
challenges: Learn OOP concepts and discover the MVC architecture.
features: Full CLI flow - Intuitive terminal interface to create a tournament, add players, launch rounds, record results, and edit reports without leaving the CLI.
Swiss pairing - Algorithm that avoids duplicate matchups and automatically handles byes when needed for balanced rounds.
Persistent JSON storage - Automatically saves all tournament and player data to JSON files so you can resume after a break.
Improved readability - Console output enhanced with ANSI color codes (built-in `ansify()` utility) for comfortable reading in light or dark themes.
Code quality - Code compliant with PEP 8, with linting tools (flake8 and HTML report) to maintain a clean, reliable codebase over time.

title: Book Scraper
description: Book Scraper is a Python program that builds an ETL pipeline to gather book information from the Books to Scrape website. It can extract data for every book in a category and optionally download every cover image.
learnings: Web scraping, ETL pipeline, BeautifulSoup, Requests, CLI
features: Scrapes every book category
Extracts data for all books in each category
Optionally downloads cover images
Automatically navigates across pages (pagination)
Exports data to CSV per category (output_data/ folder)

title: clinkey-cli
description:
Clinkey is a straightforward password generator. It produces strong, random passwords that follow the parameters selected by the user.
You can request passwords between 16 and 128 characters, composed only of letters arranged in pronounceable syllables, and optionally add digits and special characters.
Available on PyPI: `pip install clinkey-cli`
or via Homebrew: `brew tap dim-gggl/clinkey-cli && brew install clinkey-cli`.
features: -n, --number Number of passwords to generate (1 to 1000)
-l, --length Password length (8 to 128 characters)
-t, --type [ normal | strong | super_strong ] letters | letters + digits | letters + digits + special characters
-low, --lower Lowercase version
-ns, --no-sep No separator between passwords
-s, --separator Choose the separator

title: Aura
description:
Aura is an art collection management application. It helps you manage pieces, classify them, sort them, search them, share them, and add them to your collection.
Aura meets the needs of collectors from enthusiasts to experts, auctioneers, and beyond.
Aura is a responsive, accessible web application that remains extremely flexible in every aspect.
features: Create, update, delete a piece, an artist, an art type, supports, and techniques
Add an address book and a notebook
Create, manage, and track wishlists
Export detailed artwork sheets as HTML or PDF
Generate suggestions of pieces to exhibit
Customizable interface with nearly twenty original themes

title: kviR-Up
description:
kviR-Up is a dynamic web application that generates LGBTQIA+ themed movie lists.
Anyone can create a profile, add movies, share them, and comment.
The art direction is inspired by a minorities galaxy, where every community is represented by a planet.
features: Sign up and build your profile
Generate random LGBTQIA+ themed movie lists
Display dynamic content via TheMovieDB API
Share and comment on lists
Show your planets and the movies they contain
Planet creation tool powered by OpenAI

title: Clinkey
description:
Clinkey is a straightforward password generator. It produces strong, random passwords that follow the parameters selected by the user.
You can request a password between 16 and 128 characters, composed only of letters arranged in pronounceable syllables, and optionally add digits and special characters.
features: Number of passwords to generate (1 to 1000)
Password length (8 to 128 characters)
Vanilla = Letters only
Strong = Letters + digits
Super Twisted = Letters + digits + special characters
Built with pronounceable syllables
Supports generating a very large number of passwords
